abstract.para: This guide shows you how to create multiple external networks on &cloud; by modifying the &o_netw; &barcl;.

step.para: Add the following lines to /etc/crowbar/network.json, using the name of your second external network, VLAN ID, and network addresses.
Install the modified &o_netw; &barcl; and modify additional_external_networks with the name of your second external network.

sect1.title: Configure the Second External Network
sect1.para: The following steps add the network settings, including IP address pools, gateway, routing, and virtual switches.

step.para: Add these lines to /etc/neutron/l3_agent.ini with no options:
Edit /etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini to include the following line:
This change tells the l3 agent that it must rely on the physnet-to-bridge mappings.
Set up interface mapping using either Open vSwitch or Linuxbridge. For Open vSwitch run the following command:
step.screen: sudo neutron net-create public2: --provider:network_type flat \ --provider:physical_network public2: --router:external=True
step.para: For Linuxbridge run the following command:
step.screen: sudo neutron net-create --router:external True --provider:physical_network physnet1 \ --provider:network_type vlan --provider:segmentation_id 600

step.para: If a different network is used then &crow; will create a new interface mapping. Then you can use a flat network:
step.screen: sudo neutron net-create public2 --provider:network_type flat \ --provider:physical_network public2 --router:external=True
sudo neutron subnet-create --name public2 --allocation-pool \ start=192.168.135.2,end=192.168.135.127 --gateway 192.168.135.1 public2 \ 192.168.135.0/24 --enable_dhcp False

step.para: Connect router2 to the second external network:
Create another private network and connect it to router2
step.screen: sudo neutron net-create priv-net sudo neutron subnet-create priv-net --gateway 10.10.10.1 10.10.10.0/24 \ --name priv-net-sub sudo neutron router-interface-add router2 priv-net-sub

step.para: Boot a VM setting the web security group and the priv-net-sub network.
Assign a floating IP address to the VM, this time from network public2.
From the node verify that SSH is working by opening an SSH session to the VM.

sect1.title: How the Bridges are Created
sect1.para: For OVS, a new bridge will be created by &crow;, in this case br-public2. In the bridge mapping the new network will be assigned to the bridge. The interface specified in /etc/crowbar/network.json (in this case eth0.600) will be plugged into br-public2. The new public network can be created in &o_netw; using the new public network name as provider:physical_network.

For Linuxbridge &crow; will check the interface associated with public2 . If this is the same as physnet1 no interface mapping will be created. The new public network can be created in &o_netw; using physnet1 as physical network and specifying the correct VLAN ID:
sect1.screen: sudo neutron net-create public2 --router:external True \ --provider:physical_network physnet1 --provider:network_type vlan \ --provider:segmentation_id 600
sect1.para: A bridge named brq-NET_ID will be created and the interface specified in /etc/crowbar/network.json will be plugged into it. If a new interface is associated in /etc/crowbar/network.json with public2 then &crow; will add a new interface mapping and the second public network can be created using public2 as the physical network :
sect1.screen: sudo neutron net-create public2 --provider:network_type flat \ --provider:physical_network public2 --router:external=True
